teams.name: Mechanical team
teams.description: The "mech" team is responsible for designing and building the plane and UGV. This team gets to use their hands the most and be creative when designing the plane.

subteams.name: UGV Team
subteams.description: The UGV team designs and builds the Unmanned Ground Vehicle (UGV) and all related mechanisms for the competition. After the vehicle is dropped mid-flight, it has to land and carry out tasks

subteams.name: CAD Team
subteams.description: The CAD Team uses Computer Aided Design (CAD) software such as Fusion 360 to design the plane virtually.

teams.name: Programming team
teams.description: The programming team sets up the autopilot software and utilizes cutting-edge algorithms to implement all programming related aspects of the competition (which are mostly computer vision tasks).

subteams.name: GCS Team
subteams.description: The Ground Communication Systems (GCS) Team sets up the comms software and hardware that allows the plane to receive instructions and send back data to the groundstation.

subteams.name: CV Team
subteams.description: The Computer Vision (CV) Team implements all computer vision related tasks for the competition such as obstacle avoidance, image stitching, and object detection.

teams.name: Electronics team
teams.description: This team sets up all of the electronics for the plane. They work closely with the mechanical team to set up the power systems and also with the programming team to integrate the autopilot and any cameras or other tech needed.
